intro: Anemone turczaninovii var. fissasepalum, commonly known as the fissasepalum anemone, is a rare and delicate perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, white to pale pink flowers with five petals that are often notched or split, giving it its scientific name. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are typically hairy and covered in a soft, downy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
